Bera Bottler Saido Berahino: West Brom boss Tony Pulis accuses Stoke star of LYING about his MDMA drug shame 
Striker claimed he didn't know why he wasn't being picked despite knowing he had tested positive for Class A party drug By GRAEME BRYCE TONY PULIS has accused Saido Berahino of lying. 
It emerged the shamed Stoke striker tested positive for Class A party drug MDMA. Reuters 5 Saido Berahino has been accused of lying by former boss Tony Pulis 
Berahino served an eight-week ban at previous club West Brom after a routine September test uncovered the substance found in ecstasy tablets. Keep up to date with ALL the West Brom news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And Baggies boss Pulis stated he does not “give a damn” about Berahino following his £15million switch to the Potters. 
Pulis also hit back at the striker’s claims he did not know why he was not picked for three months. 
When asked if Berahino, 23, was aware of the reasons, Pulis said: “Very much so. You’d need to speak to Saido and Stoke now. Everyone knew the situation.” Reuters The Stoke striker tested positive for Class A party drug MDMA last year Saido Berahino swaps goalposts for basketball hoops in Instagram video Getty Images Berahino claimed he didn't know why he wasn't playing for old club West Brom 
However, Berahino said last week: “West Brom never actually told me why I’m not playing. 
“That hardest part was not being involved and not being told why.” 
In his defence to the FA, who hushed up the case, Berahino said he had suffered depression due to weight issues and had also turned to drink. The ex-England Under-21 ace is back at The Hawthorns today. Related Stories PARTY ON Stoke's Saido Berahino laughs on team bus as he heads back to West Brom - as we reveal he was banned by FA for taking party drug MDMA Sai no more Tony Pulis refuses to discuss Saido Berahino after it was revealed the striker DID serve an eight-week drug ban BERA DRUGS SHAME Saido Berahino failed drugs test at West Brom and was suspended by FA before signing for Stoke TEAM NEWS Stoke vs Everton team news: Stoke vs Everton team news: Seamus Coleman makes 200th Premier league appearance for Toffees while Saido Berahino is on the bench for Stoke Reuters Tony Pulis claims Berahino knew fully well he had been suspended for his drug use Getty Images Mark Hughes admits he was fully aware of Berahino's ban before signing him 
But Pulis added: “Personally I don’t give a damn now. He’s not my problem anymore. 
“Saido should be really grateful because I have been at other clubs where the kid could easily have been thrown under the bus.” 
Stoke boss Mark Hughes said: “We were made aware of it, not by West Brom or the FA. But it didn’t change our thinking of what we wanted to do.”
